page.title: 13Fishing
page.content: Fishing is a very popular pastime in our area. To kit you out you would need about Â£100. Also you would need permission to fish in a stretch of water. That means you would need to buy a permit which costs between Â£5 for a junior and Â£12 for an adult. The fines you can get are your permit taken away, tackle confiscated or a Â£5 fine for a Junior. When lead weights fall off the line they are swallowed by swans which causes lead poisining. The new weights are made of tungsten. The job of the Water Bailiff is to keep poachers off the water and to check that people have their permits. The best places to fish in the area are the Mill at Springholm and the waterfall at the Glen of Spottes. The kind of fish in our water-ways are salmon, rainbow trout, brown trout, seatrout, perch and eel.
